attributes.description: List of `C_ATTRIBUTEs` forming the definition of the tuple.
attributes.name: members

functions.meaning: True if constraints represented by this node, ignoring any sub-parts, are narrower or the same as other. Typically used during validation of specialised archetype nodes.
functions.name: c_conforms_to

functions.meaning: True if constraints represented by this node contain no further redefinitions with respect to the node other. Typically used to test if an inherited node locally contains any constraints.
functions.name: c_congruent_to

meta_info.description: Object representing a constraint on an attribute tuple, i.e. a group of attributes that are constrained together. Typically used for representing co-varying constraints like `{units, range}` constraints.
meta_info.name: C_ATTRIBUTE_TUPLE
